Uses of Package
io.permazen.encoding

Packages that use io.permazen.encoding
Package
Description
io.permazen
Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.
io.permazen.cli.config
Classes for parsing command line flags in order to configure a Permazen command line interface (CLI) session.
io.permazen.cli.parse
Permazen parsing related classes.
io.permazen.core
Core classes for the Permazen Java persistence layer.
io.permazen.core.util
Permazen core API utility classes.
io.permazen.encoding
Permazen Encodings.
io.permazen.jsck
Classes associated with Jsck, the Permazen key/value database consistency checker.
io.permazen.schema
Classes for modeling Permazen Database schemas.

    Description
    Encoding
    A range of values of some Java type, along with string and binary encodings and a total ordering of those values.

  • Classes in io.permazen.encoding used by io.permazen.core
    Class
    Description
    AbstractEncoding
    Support superclass for Encoding implementations.
    Encoding
    A range of values of some Java type, along with string and binary encodings and a total ordering of those values.
    EncodingRegistry
    A registry of Encodings.
    NullSafeEncoding
    An Encoding that wraps any other Encoding not supporting null values and adds support for null values.
    StringEncoding
    Non-null String encoding.
    UnsignedIntEncoding
    Non-null encoding for unsigned int values in the manner of UnsignedIntEncoder.
  • Classes in io.permazen.encoding used by io.permazen.core.util

    Encoding
    A range of values of some Java type, along with string and binary encodings and a total ordering of those values.
  • Classes in io.permazen.encoding used by io.permazen.encoding
    Class
    Description
    AbstractEncoding
    Support superclass for Encoding implementations.
    ArrayEncoding
    Support superclass for non-null built-in array Encodings.
    Base64ArrayEncoding
    Adds support for an alternate Base-64 String encoding for non-null primitive array types.
    Concat2Encoding
    Support superclass for non-null Encodings of values that can be decomposed into two component values.
    Concat4Encoding
    Support superclass for non-null Encodings of values that can be decomposed into four component values.
    ConvertedEncoding
    An Encoding that relies on some other Encoding, converting values to/from the other Encoding's Java type.
    Encoding
    A range of values of some Java type, along with string and binary encodings and a total ordering of those values.
    EncodingId
    A globally unique identifier that identifies an Encoding's encoding scheme.
    EncodingRegistry
    A registry of Encodings.
    IntegralArrayEncoding
    Support superclass for non-null integral primitive array encodings.
    IntegralEncoding
    Support superclass for the integral types encoded via LongEncoder.
    NullSafeEncoding
    An Encoding that wraps any other Encoding not supporting null values and adds support for null values.
    NumberEncoding
    Support superclass for the numeric primitive types.
    PrimitiveEncoding
    Support superclass for built-in primitive type encodings.
    SimpleEncodingRegistry
    A straightforward EncodingRegistry implementation that creates object array types on demand.
    StringConvertedEncoding
    Encoding for any Java type that can be encoded and ordered as a String.
    Tuple2Encoding
    Non-null Encoding for a Tuple2 created by concatenating the component Encodings.
    Tuple3Encoding
    Non-null Encoding for a Tuple3 created by concatenating the component Encodings.
    Tuple4Encoding
    Non-null Encoding for a Tuple4 created by concatenating the component Encodings.
    Tuple5Encoding
    Non-null Encoding for a Tuple5 created by concatenating the component Encodings.
    TupleEncoding
    Support superclass for non-null Encodings of Tuple classes created by concatenating the component Encodings.
